section.name: Introduction
section.p: Hey, good to see you on this page. It means that you are considereto report an issue to the Checkstyle project. We welcome anything: bug reports, feature requests to existing functionality, new Check ideas, etc.
Our issue tracker system is at Github - https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues.

section.name: How to report a bug ?
section.p: First and foremost, do not think that your issue is obvious and do not need details !!!! Even tiny issue need all details and context to be shared with us.
The best way to report an Issue is to reproduce it by our Command Line Interface. It is the most minimalistic way to launch Checkstyle.
Our project do not fix problems on any extension or plugins. Checkstyle is library that is used everywhere by number of IDEs and Static Analysis Integrators/Services.
We need minimized java file and minimized config. We do not need real source code any obfuscattion of your super secrect code is ok.

Example of report that we expect:
/var/tmp $ java -jar checkstyle-6.XX-all.jar -c config.xml test.java Starting audit... Audit done.
/var/tmp $ cat test.java public class CheckstyleTest{ // Doesn't warn - incorrect private static final int SOMETHING = 1; }
/var/tmp $ cat config.xml <?xml version="1.0"?> <!DOCTYPE module PUBLIC "-//Puppy Crawl//DTD Check Configuration 1.3//EN" "http://www.puppycrawl.com/dtds/configuration_1_3.dtd"> <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="WhitespaceAround"> <property name="allowEmptyTypes" value="true"/> </module> </module> </module>

Always specify what is expected.
Expected: violation on first line. /var/tmp/test.java:1:28: error: '{' is not preceded with whitespace.

section.name: How to request new feature for existing functoinality?
section.p: Please always specify exact name of the Check/Module.
Please provide detailed description of problem and chunks of code and config that you currently have.

section.name: How to request new Check/Module?
section.p: Please provide detailed description of problem
You have to provide examples of code and expected violations on them. The more examples the better.
If you are opensource project, please send a link to the whole java file.
